acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.22mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >2,000mg/kg (CICAD (2005)) and rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of >2,000 and >8,000 (CICAD (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation) value of >200mg/L, representing the highest of the three testing data, >1.63mg/L (CERI Hazard Data 2001-53 (2002) and (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)), >50mg/L and  >200mg/L (CICAD 66 (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,092mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 2,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-53 (2002)), 1,486mg/kg , 1,995mg/kg , 1,819mg/kg,  5,012mg/kg (CICAD 66 (2005)) and 200mg/kg, 1,486mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since the acute toxicity was Category 1 and it had no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 49% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)), and it had the bio-accumulation (log Kow=4.13(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CICAD 66 (2005), CERI Hazard Data 2001-53 (2002) and NTP DB (Access on April 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of reduced viability of the offspring in repeated dose toxicity and reproductive toxicity combined studies in rats, described in CICAD 66 (2005), though no data are available on parental toxicity.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-53 (2002) and CICAD 66 (2005)): "The substance showed moderate irritation."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) performed in accordance with OECD Test Guideline (CICAD 66 (2005)): "The substance showed no evidence of skin irritation."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the evidence of skin sensitization from guinea pig skin sensitization tests, described in CICAD 66 (2005).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "tissue degeneration in the liver and kidneys" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "reduced locomotor activity, salivation, clonic spasm, tremor, prone or lateral position" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1999)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.
